ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course was a good way to begin sorting information and organizing research for the 2 semester senior essay. Regular check ins were good to keep research on pace, but were not too stressful.
We're just sort of trying to figure out how to write our senior essay.
This course gave me a lot of help on my thesis in terms of structure and information.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The courses timetable was well spaced out. I think meetings in the Religious Studies building rather than in WTS would be better. More time for 1-on-1 feedback would be welcome, and clearer documentation in advance about what each submitted component is supposed to look like would have been good guidance. Available samples would have been super.
There isn't a ton of structure and it has a very casual atmosphere.
The class was very structured, which forced me to make my deadlines and make progress on my thesis.
It would be helpful to have a more specific outline for not only what items are due when, but what those items should consist of.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This is a required course. I would recommend it if you are a religious studies major.
You kinda have to take it for the major so...
Yes I would. Dr. Stern is a great DUS who knows what he's talking about and is passionate about all of our success.
